result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin Lee Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA and pay all mandatory costs/fees within 1 year after release from jail. Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment.

Huber privileges for work/school/treatment. No voting until civil rights are restored. Provide a DNA sample.
Consecutive to: to any sentence with credit for 42 days served
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Pay DNA and pay all mandatory costs/fees within 1 year after release from jail. Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment.

Huber privileges for work/school/treatment/day reporting center if eligible. Provide a DNA sample
Consecutive to: to any sentence with credit for zero days served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin Lee Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Calvin Lee Taylor
Current: 2202 N 14TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53205   (Effective: 04-08-2014)
Prior: 3262 North 1st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Defendant Calvin Lee Taylor in court with attorney Bernard S Stein.  Defendant Calvin Lee Taylor in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2:
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  No voting until civil rights are restored.

  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
  Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 42 days served; Huber privileges for work/school/treatment. 

Provide a DNA sample and pay the cost of same within 1 year after release from jail.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgement.

Pay all manadatory costs/fees weithin 1 year after release from jail.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgement.

AS TO COUNT 2:

  Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for zero days served; Huber privileges for work/school/treatment/ day reporting center if eligible. 

Provide a DNA sample and pay the cost of same within 1 year after release from jail.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgement.

Pay all manadatory costs/fees weithin 1 year after release from jail.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgement.

Appeal rights given

Attorney Bernard S Stein in court, defendant Calvin Lee Taylor not in court, in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Calvin Lee Taylor in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton for Bernard S Stein.  Defendant Calvin Lee Taylor in custody.  Paul Hauer for Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  eam
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Calvin Lee Taylor in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Calvin Lee Taylor in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
